creator: thaiha@psv.com.vn
text:
Compiling ssl module (optional module) on Windows needs some utilities (bison, 
flex, sed). It should be documented in 'win_compiling.html' file or somewhere. 
And where we can get those tools also. (http://cygwin.com ?)

creator: towerofpower@operamail.com
text:
Requires Perl and Cygwin(bison, flex, sed, gawk(renamed awk)).  Apache install 
docs are not helpful.  Search google.

askme: Why did you close this?  This is a legitimate note about something
that can be improved in the documentation.
creator: slive@apache.org
towerofpower@operamail.com
text:
Because I see this all the time on this site.  But you are right.  There should 
be a sticky type of note at the top, with info like this.

I guess I've always done a "touch" on *.c and *.h in the modules/ssl directory 
to avoid having to get these tools....

[And I have cygwin installed and in the path...]
creator: jessh@ptc.com
mads@apache.org
text:
flex/bison shouldn't be necessary unless you're changing either
modules/ssl/ssl_expr_parse.y or modules/ssl/ssl_expr_scan.l -
earlier there were problems with timestamping, but the unix 
release script has been fixed long ago to make sure that doesn't 
happen.
